p: Plants have long been used in traditional healing systems to treat diarrhoea. These traditional medicines may be given as single-component therapies or they may be prescribed in combination to target the multiple negative effects of diarrhoea (loose stools, cramps, loss of electrolytes, and possible fever). The activity of several of the herbal preparations used traditionally to treat diarrhoea and other gastrointestinal diseases has already been validated by rigorous scientific evaluation. This is particularly true for plant medicines used in traditional Indian healing systems (including Ayurveda, Siddha, and Unani) [ 4â€“ 6] and in traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) [ 7, 8]. In contrast, the potential of many Australian medicinal plants in alleviating the symptoms of diarrhoea and inhibiting the pathogenic causes has been relatively neglected.
